website_summaries.verdict: The D-Link DIR-842 is a $60 dual-band router that delivers solid throughput, has four wired LAN ports, plenty of management settings, and is a breeze to install.

customer_reviews.title: Decent cheaper 802.11ac router
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this router exclusively over the last three months for connecting wireless devices to my home network and have found this device is capable of handling 4 devices streaming 4k video with no issues. I am yet to test the stability of both wired and wireless devices but I'm reasonably confident it should be able to handle 5 devices at the same time. Usual wireless transfer rate is 28-30mb/s. Also, a nice added bonus to have the option of a guest network that comes in handy when visitors stay over for a few days.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Excellent performance
customer_reviews.text: We have Virgin Media M200 Fibre Broadband and a home Ethernet network with 6 outlets. However, the Wi-Fi speed direct from the Virgin Hub3 was never more than 50 Mb/s, even right next to the box. Last year I installed one of these routers upstairs, connected to the Ethernet network, and now another downstairs. I now get Wi-Fi speeds of around 90 Mb/s using the 2.4Ghz band and around 215 Mb/s using the 5 GHz band. These are speeds using the Speedtest app on my Huawei P20 phone. In busy periods the speeds are lower, but still very acceptable. I am therefore delighted with these routers.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Edgware

customer_reviews.title: Good value but dubious build quality
customer_reviews.text: It seems to work as described, BUT 1) there is a loose screw rattling around in the case - I can see it through the ventilation slots. 2) as others have said, the power lead is ridiculously short - approx. 1 metre. Although it can be wall-mounted you would need a rather high socket to do this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High power router , copes with many devices
customer_reviews.text: I've had a few routers over the years and so far this one is probably the best that I've employed. Coverage appears good in a difficult (large ish Victorian house). Set up is fairly easy, but some features are buried in the advanced sections. I've used their technical support too . Their knowledge is good I'd say but not perfect. However they have been very supportive of attempting to resolve one or two specific features (unusual) that I wished to employ. At this price it certainly gets my recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: bayard1music

customer_reviews.title: Outdated and poor
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a router so I could locate in a better position in the house and use the existing virgin hub just as the modem. However even with this situated in the centre of the house with less walls to go through, the signal is still worse than the old virgin hub 3. I can be one room away (with only stud walls) and the signal is terrible. I'm not sure if there's an issue with the aerials, as it seems ok in one direction but not the other. Also it routinely drips the connection to some devices and then getting it to reconnect is impossible without rebooting it. All in all this has been a big waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Bodger

customer_reviews.title: Good price but sub-par WiFi signal strength
customer_reviews.text: Price was good but, in spite of the four antennae, one of my bits of equipment which had worked fine with two other routers wouldn't hold a connection with this D-Link device. I checked the signal strength at the equipment and the D-Link router's signal was drowned out by neighbours' devices. I changed to an old Asus router and the signal was much better. So this one going back as it's not up to the task of serving all of a medium-sized house.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Solid Router - Well priced versus similar spec
customer_reviews.text: As i am currently a standard EE router, anything would be an upgrade but i wanted something that would really deliver the goods. We stream a lot of music and TV so looking at a variety of reviews this seemed to be a great option for the money. I have put my trust in Dlink products before so i figured the DIR-882 was a safe bet. Thankfully so, up and running within minutes and a noticeable uptick in my home wifi performance. I really don't think you can ask for much more for the money...
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: It does the job.
customer_reviews.text: The device works ok but it was not as good as I hoped. It solves the problem of wifi coverage and the bandwidth seems to be adequate. However, it only reaches into half the house even though it is located on the ground floor near to the central hall of a 4 bedroom detached house. The device is connected to the internet via a paired ethernet mains extenders connected to the main broadband router (a bt hub6) located on an outer wall at at the other side of the house. The ethernet ports are not used.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Using For Virgin Broadband 5/5
customer_reviews.text: I decided to put my Virgin Superhub in modem mode and then use this D-Link as the main router. I have not experienced any disconnection or Wi-Fi signal drop issues so so far so good. I would say I live in a medium-sized property and the Wi-Fi signal at the far end rooms are quite weak but in the Attic The 5ghz signal is very strong. Having said that, I have only placed the router in the middle shelf under the tv (so not the best location). So far so good
customer_reviews.author: Ice-Man

customer_reviews.title: A huge step up from my ISP router
customer_reviews.text: I live in a house with really solid walls, loads of wireless devices and my ISP (a UK service provider that starts with 'S' and ends with 'Y'). The ISP router was cheaper, very cheap and failed to get the job done, then spent money on repeaters, power-line adaptors and really long ether cables in order to setup my network (hundreds of £). I purchased this to use as a wireless router for my devices, I can now say I have remove the power-line adaptors and Ethernet cables from my setup. This works a treat due to MU-MIMO.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Really good router, solved all our multi-device problems
customer_reviews.text: We had a rubbish virgin media router which just didn't cover our house, and kept crashing for everyone, since switching to a dedicated router, this has been a thing of the past
customer_reviews.author: HotCupOfTeaPls

customer_reviews.title: Great router for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good router and easy to setup. Gives a better signal than the Hub 3 that comes from Virgin. The stock firmware used to configure the router is easy to setup and a decent amount of options, although it lacks features if you're more technically inclined and want greater control. On the plus side this router is compatible with DD-WRT and works very well with it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but nothing special.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace home wifi provided by my Virgin Hub3 - which didn't quite cover the extension. I used powerline to place the d-link centrally in the house. The wifi coverage was average - not fantastic. There was a noticeable problem with devices failing to connect and needing to be restarted. Chromecasts, Samsung tv and S7 phone. Sent it back and received a refund. A bit disappointed by the router as I was hoping for a significant improvement. Excellent service, though.
customer_reviews.author: Mat

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work for me with Vodafone broadband and router. Wasn't obvious to set up and I am tech savvy. Signal wasn't up to much either or the speed. There are other options out there that are better and easier to set up. I've moved to a Tenda mesh solution and it is working really well.
customer_reviews.author: David Wolfy

customer_reviews.title: It’s fast and reliable.
customer_reviews.text: This works. It’s super fast, super reliable and I’ve had no problems with it now in over 6 months. It’s worth it just so the kids don’t think it’s the end of the world every 10 minutes when Instatube buffers.
customer_reviews.author: wonderboy1974

customer_reviews.title: Good router EXCEPT that the AC adapter has a very short lead
customer_reviews.text: Why doesn't the router have an AC adapter with a decently long power cable? Many routers are installed a fair distance away from the power socket, and the 1m cable is really not sufficient. So I had to spend money on an AC extension cord. Apart from that, has been a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Indulis Bernsteins

customer_reviews.title: Great router to replace Virgin Media Hub
customer_reviews.text: I had a Virgin Media Hub which was dropping out and speed was variable. Found myself constantly checking broadband speed to see if it was slowing down. Decided to buy another router and use the VM hub in modem mode. Very please with this router because I now get near top speed and drop outs has stopped. I can also plug in a HDD to it. I no longer check my broadband speed all the time which is how it should be :)
customer_reviews.author: Spiper

customer_reviews.title: Huge upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Before this router I was getting 60 mbps wifi speeds with virgin's 200mbps package, now I'm getting 190 mbps, sometimes even over 200! It did everything I asked for. Great router. And I'm not dropping out of games unexpectedly like I was using the Virgin Hub.
customer_reviews.author: Mvelo

customer_reviews.title: D-Link DIR-842 Wireless AC1200...
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous router. Fabulous price. I had been trying to increase the WiFi signal upstairs as it was pretty bad. Messed about with numerous older routers with very little success. Saw this dlink router and gave it a crack. Just totally amazed. Set this up as an access point and it truly performs. On the 2.4ghz I'm getting speeds of around 50 - 70meg and on the 5.ghz well over a 100meg. Some rewiews mention poor WiFi signal, but for me a very good investment. Happy as Larry. Wish I'd found it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Storming

customer_reviews.title: Weak and slow WiFi
customer_reviews.text: 5Ghz can't go more that 500Mbps which not even close how it advertised. If you are looking for 800Mbps range WiFi speed, this is not your device. On 5Ghz, 500Mbps is enough for you, it is good value for money. I'll return this.
customer_reviews.author: mohacs

customer_reviews.title: A router that kick's ass!
customer_reviews.text: After suffering with the excuse of a router you get with VM, this router is like the big daddy, and at a good price. Since setting up (which was easy) had no drop outs, super fast connection on all our devices (over 10 in our house incl. Hive and Alexa) Had it 2 weeks now, and wish I'd got one years ago! Best thing you will ever do is turn your VM hub into a modem and say hello to fast wifi :D
customer_reviews.author: Rik Hopkinson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect replacement for VM Super Hub 3
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace the (useless) VM Super hub 3 after suffering continuous Wi-Fi dropouts and couldn’t be happier. Since installing, I’ve had a solid Wi-Fi signal with little/no dropout. No complaints-go for it!
customer_reviews.author: Roger O'Grady-Walsh

customer_reviews.title: An OK router with poor firmware.
customer_reviews.text: It’s functionally good in principle but the firmware is badly written. Schedules don’t work properly and it seems to behave differently depending on how it feels! Parental limits via schedule also don’t work. That said it is a good router in general. I’m just waiting for a firmware update.
customer_reviews.author: PaulWhibble

customer_reviews.title: Frequently disconnects and needs restarting
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for the first few months but now only lasts a few minutes before reporting that the internet connection has been unplugged ("Wan(eth3) Disconnect" in its logs) From searching online for this message I found many people have had this problem with Dlink routers. Waste of money. Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Embee

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: Super easy installation. Purchased for upgrading home network and it’s very user friendly set up. Anybody without any knowledge will be able to set it all up without any issues. Stable connection, good speed and good design. Plenty of features for various applications.
customer_reviews.author: Giedrius

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup, cheap but WiFi penetration poor
customer_reviews.text: It is very easy to set up, very little to do for a basic working WiFi extender. The issue is signal from wifi, it is pretty poor. Their older model was far better, I put them side by side and had double the distance.
customer_reviews.author: Marty7

customer_reviews.title: WiFi range is very poor
customer_reviews.text: If you need WiFi coverage over any distance this product is not for you: It will not give more than 10 meters coverage. I sent the first unit back on the instructions of the Technical people. They replaced it but the coverage did not improve at all. Over a wired connection there is no problem
customer_reviews.author: Lor

customer_reviews.title: Smart
customer_reviews.text: Very smart looking router and a great improvement from my superhub 3. Has VPN access so you can access your home network from anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Burgess

customer_reviews.title: Good allrounder
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace the spotty wifi on a virgin media box. I'm really happy with the coverage and ease of setup. So far, we've not had a single issue with poor coverage and dropouts.
customer_reviews.author: MM71

customer_reviews.title: Much better than stock product!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up router, plugs in to the modem and then a little while after playing with it you get the WiFi you dreamed of... Or at least much better than virgin media hub 3.0...
customer_reviews.author: Kapsci

customer_reviews.title: Not very stable
customer_reviews.text: Returned as the signal was not very stable and son was unable to game online as could not open the 'NAT'. We got no response from customer service when we asked for support.
customer_reviews.author: Penny Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, easy to use but WIFI could be a bit stronger
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as I needed 5Ghz WIFI. The strength of the 5Ghz WIFI isn’t the strongest. My neighbours’ routers come up stronger. But it’s got some really easy to use QoS settings to prioritise devices on the WIFI. We use this to prioritise our Fire Sticks so that they stream smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Darren

customer_reviews.title: Really quick and surprisingly compact
customer_reviews.text: I brought this to replace my EE bright box router, I’ve recently invested in mesh wi-fi so figured a more significant router would be worth investing in and would provide a better and faster wireless speed. I’ve definitely seen a noticeable jump in DL/UL speeds since getting it up and running and was also surprised at how compact the router is (looks a fair bit bigger in the picture). It also seems to work seamlessly with the mesh units.
customer_reviews.author: SteveJ

customer_reviews.title: Very limited functionality
customer_reviews.text: My previous two routers were D-Link and generally satisfactory; however when the last one eventually failed on its 5GHz operation I purchased this item. It is disappointing. If all you want to do is plug it in and connect your phone it may suit you; for anything more than that its functionality is limited to say the least. I have returned it and purchased an Asus unit instead - much better in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Don  Weir

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I’ve plugged it behind the router at home; within the same room we connect to the 5GHz wifi, further rooms we connect to the 2.4GHz wifi; we have no more disconnections; I changed all pre defined passwords (admin, wifi) and that’s it!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Alexandre Dubreuil

customer_reviews.title: 5 star
customer_reviews.text: Great router has improved our rubbish router from plusnet we can all get a signal now on this router after endless phone calls to plusnet this router has done the job easy to set up great price very happy with it fast delivery
customer_reviews.author: pam j

customer_reviews.title: great router
customer_reviews.text: had no issues and did have a huge difference on signal overall. easy to set up & navigate too. cheers!
customer_reviews.author: R S

customer_reviews.title: Faulty after just a year of use.
customer_reviews.text: Was working fine for a year, then it started dropping the speed of my connection. At first i thought it was the Virgin Media connection/Hub 3 itself, but then after removing this router the speed went up to the contracted top speed and never drops. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Mohammed

customer_reviews.title: Great for extending signal without loss of speed!
customer_reviews.text: I used this along with a gigabit cable to extend the network from my house to the log cabin (approx 30m away) and it's done a brilliant job. I have 2 new separate wifi logins 2ghz and 5ghz. I'm getting the same speed as my house so I'm very pleased. Did the job I wanted flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Matrix

customer_reviews.title: Glaring QOS issues.
customer_reviews.text: Until D-Link allow you to completely turn off the QOS engine I wouldn’t recommend this router for anything more than a few devices and average use. Dreadful.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup and easy to follow instructions on how to change you passwords and stuff
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Don’t bother
customer_reviews.text: Started off great my internet speed was a massive boost compared to my old plusnet router. My sky box won’t pick up the network however. Now when items drop off the signal it asks for password and tells me i am putting in the wrong password, it’s just become frustrating so going to return it and get something more stable
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: excellent
customer_reviews.text: Very good router. Everything is ready, just plug in and works. Worth to buy.
customer_reviews.author: kate

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: It’s ok but still have problems with WiFi reaching the back of the house.
customer_reviews.author: rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Working fine
customer_reviews.text: The product has been working fine, Not as good as my now dead asus rt n65u router Signal not as strong . So far working not dropped connection
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: Strong and Stable connection at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Much better router than my old one from my ISP and drastically improved my connection stability
customer_reviews.author: Gaius T.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap gamer router
customer_reviews.text: So far asus is the best make i found for stability for gaming. No other brands works as well.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: D-Link DIR-809 4-Port Switch Dual Band Wireless Router UK Model
customer_reviews.text: great for using wired but wireless is not so great up stairs and you need to keep rebooting it for the bars to go up
customer_reviews.author: Angelrush

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what i needed.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. I was after a good wifi range and ability to run dd-wrt. On both counts this router fulfills my needs. Surely recommended.
customer_reviews.author: I. Dar

customer_reviews.title: No usb port
customer_reviews.text: No usb port. One of the antennas is very weak and flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew.

customer_reviews.title: Quality,Value,excellent Router
customer_reviews.text: Excellent wi fi base for complex home network.Dual band ,guest support,highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: OCD OK

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and perfect for wi fi signal in whole house.
customer_reviews.text: Great for home networking and recommend to anyone who wants to upgrade/replace the new Router for home networking.
customer_reviews.author: Dad of three

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant for the money
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up, very intuitive software on the router its self and has definitely stopped the lag on WoW. Yes there are better routers out their but for double the price. brilliant!
customer_reviews.author: Mojo363

customer_reviews.title: It's close to A4 foot print.
customer_reviews.text: A real beast of a WiFi hub, bought to "replace" Virgin Media Super Hub WiFi. Linked them with ethernet cable, all good so far.
customer_reviews.author: Stewart Burnett

customer_reviews.title: Awful Connection Issues
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly for about a month, after which it has kept disconnecting randomly. Always have to unplug and replug the cable, and turn it off and on again. Might as well get a different router that will work reliably.
customer_reviews.author: Ani

customer_reviews.title: powerful wifi
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace old Netgear router. It's used by about 30 people all day and seems fast and stable even from 50m away and through concrete walls. Easy to install and I have not needed any technical support.
customer_reviews.author: Jon B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice easy installation and much better than the new Sky router it supplements
customer_reviews.text: Up on wall and running next to my Sky router in 5 minutes. Great piece of kit.
customer_reviews.author: John Madden

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't change settings
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't change any settings as it wouldn't accept its default password. Sent back
customer_reviews.author: gcl999

customer_reviews.title: OKish
customer_reviews.text: Good unit, bit overpriced IMHO, but I paid and no one forced me to. Assumed it had wps but it didn't, my fault.
customer_reviews.author: EdW

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Does the job amazingly good. The signal travelling way outside my house. Internet speed increased 40% to compare with my ISP provided router. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Tadas Sokoladas

customer_reviews.title: Price reflects signal
customer_reviews.text: Signal is very very poor, looks like the 2.4GHz channel has issues. 5GHz is fine but obviously so long as you aren’t too far away from the router.
customer_reviews.author: Next

customer_reviews.title: great wifi
customer_reviews.text: Excellent piece of kit, I have allocated the high end users, my gaming, kids Amazon streaming and so far no shouts of 'No Wifi'.
customer_reviews.author: O. Hilmi

customer_reviews.title: Good but not brilliant.
customer_reviews.text: Easy installation. Speed good but singal strength not as strong as I had hoped for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value for money, only downfall is it is quite big
customer_reviews.text: Good value for money, only downfall is it is quite big
customer_reviews.author: Ingrid P

customer_reviews.title: Really would not recommend, made things worse
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t make the WiFi better only made it worse and just refused to connect to anything most of the time
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up
customer_reviews.text: V simple set up out of the box. Replaced old linksys unstable router. This is working v well with many linked devices
customer_reviews.author: Niall HUrson

customer_reviews.title: WiFi sorted.
customer_reviews.text: Due to to many devices added Tony WiFi connection a WiFi hub was best option to increase the connections
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Price
customer_reviews.text: Set up straight out of box did what I wanted it to do, fantastic
customer_reviews.author: Ian H

customer_reviews.title: 5 star
customer_reviews.text: Perfect gamer / streamer router. Very fast , easy setup. I recommend to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Robin Sipos

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: great if you are in the same room, terrible when you move to other areas of your house.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: The second one came as a replacement almost a month later so the service was very bad. Its working so far
customer_reviews.text: First one i bought broke in a week while I was in Bahrain, could not access my home server the entire time and was quite upset. The second one came as a replacement almost a month later so the service was very bad. Its working so far
customer_reviews.author: Marlo S.

customer_reviews.title: Good router for the price
customer_reviews.text: Did you what I needed, extended the range if the wifi in my house as the sky box didn’t cover some areas. Copied the SSID so you wouldn’t notice the extra access point. For £28 I am happy with this product, you can spend loads of money but what are your needs? This is suitable as it’s can do 4K streaming over wifi
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

product_meta.title: D-Link DIR-842 Dual Band Wireless AC1200 Wave 2 Wi-Fi Router with 4-Port Gigabit Ethernet
product_meta.description:
Style Name:4K Streaming| Size Name:AC 1200 MbpsThe DIR-842 Wireless AC1200 MU-MIMO Dual-Band Router combines the latest high-speed Wave 2 802.11ac dual-band Wi-Fi with Gigabit Ethernet ports to provide a seamless networking experience. The DIR-842’s enhanced security features keep data safe from unwanted network intruders, whilst the increased range and reliability of Wireless AC technology allows you to stay connected even under heavy network utilisation or in rooms that have bad wireless signal.

LEGAL DISCLAIMER
Product is sourced and shipped from the European Economic Area (EEA). Product is genuine original from manufacturer authorized distributors.

BOX CONTAINS


 * 1 x DLink Wireless AC1200 Dual Band Gigabit Router



See more
feature_bullets: The Wireless AC1200 MU-MIMO Dual-Band Router (DIR-842) combines the high-speed Wave 2 802.11ac with

It's enhanced security features keep data safe from unwanted network intruders, whilst the increased range and reliability of Wireless AC technology allows you to stay connected - even under heavy network utilisation or in rooms that have bad wireless signal
Lightning-fast Wi-Fi speeds of up to 1,167 Mbps1 (867 Mbps on the 5 GHz frequency band and 300 Mbps on the 2.4 GHz frequency band) so you can meet the ever-higher demand from multimedia applications
Four high-performance external antennas will bring out stronger Wi-Fi coverage throughout your home; more devices that will connect faster to your network and no more dead zones
In addition, 10/100/1000 Gigabit Ethernet ports give you solid, dependable wired performance for devices such as smart TVs, gaming consoles and network storage devices

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars638 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
